snippet: Dennis Boyd, better known as Oil Can, said he probably pitched under the influence of cocaine “at every ballpark” in his 10-year career, most of it with the Red Sox in the 1980s.
abstract: Former MLB pitcher Dennis Boyd admits that he probably pitched under the influence of cocaine 'at every ballpark' in his 10-year career, most of it with the Boston Red Sox in the 1980s.
lead_paragraph: Dennis Boyd, better known as Oil Can, said he probably pitched under the influence of cocaine “at every ballpark” in his 10-year career, most of it with the Red Sox in the 1980s.

headline.seo: Oil Can Boyd Says He Used Cocaine
headline.main: Oil Can Boyd Says He Used Cocaine
headline.print_headline: Oil Can Boyd Says He Used Cocaine
